cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 170, Number 146 (Thursday, September 19, 2024)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. WASSERMAN SCHULTZ:H.R. 9713.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Pursuant to Article I, Section 8, Clause 3 relating to thepower of Congress to regulate Commerce with foreign Nations,and among the several States, and with the Indian Tribes.The single subject of this legislation is:Providing for the reauthorization of the BIRD EnergyProgram[Page H5526]

item.text: Referred to the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology, and in addition to the Committees on Foreign Affairs, and Homeland Security, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

bill.title: BIRD Energy and U.S.-Israel Energy Center Reauthorization Act of 2024

item.title: BIRD Energy and U.S.-Israel Energy Center Reauthorization Act of 2024
BIRD Energy and U.S.-Israel Energy Center Reauthorization Act of 2024
To amend the Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007 to expand and reauthorize the United States-Israel Energy Cooperation program, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology, and in addition to the Committees on Foreign Affairs, and Homeland Security, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
